Title.evidence: Intraoperative Blood Salvage in Liver Resection: A Randomised Controlled Trial

Trial_Design.evidence: Living liver donors scheduled for liver graft procurement were randomly assigned

Participants.evidence: Living liver donors scheduled for liver graft procurement

Intervention.evidence: randomly assigned to a blood salvage group or a control group

Objective.evidence: This randomised controlled trial assessed the effectiveness of intraoperative blood salvage in reducing blood loss during liver resection.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was blood loss during liver parenchymal division.

Blinding.evidence: surgeons were blinded to group allocation

Number_Randomised.evidence: Seventy-nine donors were randomised: 40 to the blood salvage group and 39 to the control group.

Result_Outcome.evidence: intraoperative blood salvage reduced blood loss (adjusted OR 0.31; 95% CI 0.11â€“0.85, P = 0.025)

Harms.evidence: No adverse events were reported in either group.

Trial_Registration.evidence: Trial registration and funding details are not provided.

Funding.evidence: Trial registration and funding details are not provided.
